document.masterDocTitle: New synonyms of Euconnus (Tetramelus) kraussi Reitter, 1880 (Coleoptera Staphylinidae, Scydmaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New synonyms of Euconnus (Tetramelus) kraussi Reitter, 1880 (Coleoptera Staphylinidae, Scydmaeninae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Entomology, National Museum, Natural History Museum, Cirkusová 1740, CZ- 193 00 Praha 9 - Horní Počernice, Czech Republic.

subSubSection.paragraph: Types: LT ♂ , PLT ( 1♂ , 1♀ ), all deposited in MNHN

subSubSection.paragraph: Types: 3ST ( 1♂ , 2♀ ), all deposited in Franz collection ( NMW )

Euconnus ( Tetramelus ) nachuzrischwilii Franz, 1986: 42

subSubSection.paragraph: Type locality: „Grusinischen Heerstrasse südlich des Kreuzpasses und nördlich von Anamuri in etwa 1000 m “.
Types: HT ♂ , PT (9 exx.), all deposited in Franz collection ( NMW )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Euconnus ( Tetramelus ) nachuzrischwilii Franz
:
Vít & Hlaváč, 1998: 146
, Figs 11, 12.

subSubSection.paragraph:
All Caucasian species of the subgenus
Tetramelus
are very similar in general apperance. They are small or middle-sized, light yellowish-brown, microphthalmous, with slender antennae and legs. The body length of
Euconnus ( Tetramelus ) kraussi
is 1.40–1.60 mm . In the original description the body length of
Euconnus ( Tetramelus ) marinae
is stated to be 1.55–1.75 mm ( Franz 1979 ). The length of this wide range was already put in doubt ( Vít & Hlaváč 1998: 146 ). All three syntypes in NMW were measured and they have the following lengths: 1.57; 1.43; 1.43 mm . Consequently, the Franz’s measurements were not correct.
During the present study, the following material was studied:

Tetramelus nachuzrischwilii Franz
:
HOLOTYPE
, ♂ : five labels, “Zentralkaukassus / lg. H. Franz , 1.-8.6.77 [date crossed out]“ [printed, white], “Umg. Ananuri / b. Tbilisi “ [white, printed], “ E. (
Tetramelus
) / nachuzraschwili m. / det. H. Franz “ [white, handwriten and printed], „ HOLOTYPE “ [red, handwriten], “ HOLOTYPE /
Euconnus ( Tetramelus )
/ nachuzrischwili Franz / = E.
T. kraussi Reitter
/ P. Hlaváč det., 2020“ [red, printed] ( NMW ).

PARATYPES , 9 sps: four labels, “Zentralkaukassus / lg. H. Franz , 1.-8.6.77 [this dates are striked down]“ [printed, white], “Umg. Ananuri / b. Tbilisi “ [white, printed], “ E. (
Tetramelus
) / nachuzraschwili m. / PARATYPUS “ [white, handwriten and printed], “ PARATYPE /
Euconnus ( Tetramelus )
/ nachuzrischwili Franz / = E.
T. kraussi Reitter
/ P. Hlaváč det., 2020“ [red, printed] ( NMW )
.
Remarks. All ten specimens of the type series have the same collecting date, 1- 8.6.1977 , there are no specimens with the date 12.7.1985 , indicated in the original description ( Franz 1986: 42 ).

Tetramelus marinae Franz
:
LECTOTYPE , ♂ , here designated: four labels, “ Kachetien / Umg. Shuante,
800 m
“ [white, printed], “ Zentralkaukassus / lg. H. Franz , 1.-8.6.77“ [white, printed], “
Euconnus
/ (
Tetramelus
) /
marinae
/ det. H. Franz m. “ [red, handwriten and printed], “ LECTOTYPE /
Euconnus ( Tetramelus )
/
marinae Franz
/ = E.
T. kraussi Reitter
/ P. Hlaváč det., 2020“ ( NMW )
.
PARALECTOTYPES
, 1 ♂ , 1 ♀ : four labels, “ Kachetien / Umg. Shuante,
800 m
“ [white, printed], “Zentralkaukassus / lg. H. Franz , 1.-8.6.77“ / “
Euconnus
/ (
Tetramelus
) /
marinae
m. / PARATYPUS “ [white, handwriten and printed], “ PARALECTOTYPE /
Euconnus ( Tetramelus )
/
marinae Franz
/ = E.
T. kraussi Reitter
/ P. Hlaváč det., 2020“ [red, printed] ( NMW )
.

Natural History. All recently collected specimens have been taken by sifting leaf litter in deciduous or mixed forests.
